moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Advanced Theory and Practices/10 Advanced Engagement Metrics/Percentage Completed Watch

overview.quote: Not just retention in a different outfitâ€”it's the percentage of people who stuck around until the very end.
overview.introText: While closely related to retention, percentage completed watch has become increasingly important to algorithms as platforms seek to reward truly satisfying content.

keyTerms.definition: The percentage of viewers who watch your video all the way to the end.
Points in your video where viewers tend to leave, often caused by fluff or unnecessary content.
How platforms measure whether viewers feel their time was well-spent with your content.
When viewers feel completely satisfied by your content, increasing likelihood of watching to completion.

actionPlan: Ruthlessly cut fluff from your video endings
Aim for 33% completed view rate on 1-3 min videos
Test different video lengths to find your sweet spot
End videos at peak interest when possible
Track which topics have highest completion rates

mainContent.title: Why Platforms Care About Completion
mainContent.text: Platforms prioritize completed watch rates because they demonstrate viewer satisfaction better than average view duration, which can be gamed with longer videos.

summaryPoints: TikTok shifted to prioritize completion over duration
Target 33% completed view rate for optimal push
Signals content quality from start to finish

mainContent.title: Optimizing Your Video Length
mainContent.text: Different platforms have different preferences. TikTok favors videos over 1 minute (especially for Creator Fund eligibility), while Instagram can reward ultra-short content.

summaryPoints: Instagram can reward videos under 15 seconds
YouTube prefers longer content with high completion

mainContent.title: Editing for Higher Completion
mainContent.text: The most effective way to boost completion rates is ruthlessly cutting any content that doesn't maintain peak interest, especially at the end of your videos.

summaryPoints: Remove thank yous and concluding statements
Consider ending mid-sentence at peak interest

proTips.text: For extreme completion rates, try ending your video mid-sentence at the most interesting point. Viewers may even watch multiple times.
If your Creator Fund revenue matters, focus on TikTok's 1+ minute sweet spot with 33% completion rather than ultra-short content.

finalWords.description: Every viewer who watches to the end tells algorithms your content is worth recommending.
